doc.field: Records of the Center for Religion and Media
Records of the Center for Religion and Media

The Center for Religion and Media at New York University is one of the ten Centers of Excellence funded by The Pew Charitable Trusts from 2003-2007. The Center works to further interdisciplinary and cross-crultural knowledge on the intersection of religious practices and ideas with contemporary mass media. The Center sponsors education events and produces the web journal The Revealer: a review of religion and media. The Center for Religion and Media is a joint project of the Religious Studies Program and the Center for Media, Culture, and History. This collection consists of the records of the Center for Religion and Media from approximately 2004-2019, including administrative records, publications, and materials documenting the center's events, including flyers, programs, audio recordings, and video recordings.

This collection consists of the records of the Center for Religion and Media from approximately 2004-2019, including administrative records, publications, and materials documenting the center's events, including flyers, programs, audio recordings, and video recordings.

New York University. The Center for Religion and Media

This collection consists of the records of the Center for Religion and Media from approximately 2004-2019, including administrative records, publications, websites, and materials documenting the center's events, including flyers, programs, audio recordings, and video recordings.

The Center for Religion and Media at New York University is one of the ten Centers of Excellence funded by The Pew Charitable Trusts from 2003-2007. The Center works to further interdisciplinary and cross-crultural knowledge on the intersection of religious practices and ideas with contemporary mass media. The Center sponsors education events and produces the web journal The Revealer: a review of religion and media. The Center for Religion and Media is a joint project of the Religious Studies Program and the Center for Media, Culture, and History.

Transferred by Kali Handelman, Program Coordinator and Editor, The Revealer for The Center for Religion and Media in June 2019. The accession numbers associated with this transfer are 2019.057 and 2019.115.

https://wp.nyu.edu/crm/ and https://therevealer.org/ were selected by curators and captured through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. The accession number associated with these websites is 2019.123.

Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact university-archives@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact university-archives@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
